result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis B Hassel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 1 Life Sentence. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $342  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any of victim's family.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

PM Court Reporter: Jenny Poirior

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorneys Anthony Christopher Rios and Jon Helland and Investigator Katie Nusinsky. Matthew D. Moeser and Rebekah Rennicke with Det. James Grann and Det.  Eric Vosburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State addresses issue of DE's 4/22/15 statement. Miranda Goodchild hearing held. Jury enters at 9:14 AM. Det. J.G. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Exhibits 277-306 marked and received. Cross. Redirect. Exhibit 307 marked and received. Jury release for break at 10:48 AM. Jury enters at 11:13 AM. State requests stipulation regarding bank records be read to the jury and moves  exhibit 308 regarding bank account records into evidence, granted by court. State moves all items except 6, 83, and 125 into evidence. No objection. All exhibits except for 6, 83, and 125 received. State rests. Det. S.S. duly sworn and testified. Direct by Attorney Helland. Side bar at 11:20 AM. Ends at 11:21 AM. Cross. Witness released from subpoena. LT. M.T. duly sworn and testified. Direct by Attorney Helland. Cross. B.H. duly sworn and testified. Direct by Attorney Helland. Cross. Witness released from subpoena. Side bar at 11:40 AM. Ends at 11:40 AM. Jury released for lunch at 11:41 AM. Attorney Helland puts on record issue with officer subpoena. Parties reach stipulation. DE rests not in front of jury. DE moves for directed verdict for DE. Argument. Court denies motion. Court has colloquy with DE as to DE testifying. DE elects to not testify. Court holds jury instruction conference outside of the jury.  Jury enters at 1:40 PM. DE rests. Rebuttal witness Det. D.N. still under oath, testified. DIrect by State. Jury released for break at 1:45 PM. Jury enters at 2:06 PM. Jury instructions 100, 157, 147, 148, 150, 145, 110, 1010, 170, 255A, 103, 195, 162, 155, 158, 180, 190, 315, 200, 205, 300, 325, 140-as amended, 160, 460, 484, 515 read. Closing arguments. Two alternate jurors selected and sent to separate jury room at 3:58 PM. Bailiffs sworn. Jury released for deliberations at 3:59 PM. Jury question number 1 at 6:45 PM. Answered at 7:12 PM. Jury enters with verdict of guilty at 8:28 PM. Jury individually polled. Jury excused at 8:31 PM. State moves for judgment on the verdict and for court to sentence to life in prison. Hearing to be set as to parole eligibility. DE moves for judgment not withstanding the verdict. Ct denies motion. Ct enters judgment on the verdict. Ct revokes bond. Imposes life sentence. SEH to be set. State requests PSI. No objection. Ct orders PSI.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Anthony Christopher Rios and Jon Helland. Matthew Moeser appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Notice of learned treatise and motion for judicial notice. State has no objection to court taking judicial notice. Argument as to learned treatise. Ct agrees it is a learned treatise. Motion to conduct video depositions. Parties update court on date and status of DE at that time. State's motion to enlarge time to file report from Agent C. Objection by DE. Argument. Potential daubert issues. Motion is denied. Daubert motions due 3/23/17. Will be paper review. Brief to be filed with motion. State's reply due 3/28/17. DE's final reply due 3/31/17. Issues relate to Agent Carol's 2/28 and 3/10 submissions. State requests clarification as to objection to motion to enlarge time as there were three motions filed. First and second motions were not objected to. State's motion challenging admissability of Dr. R.C's TOD calculations. Parties agree Dr. R.C. is an expert. Argument as to admissability. Ct to hold Daubert hearing immediately prior to Dr. R.C's testimony. Motion to exclude known or unknown 3rd party other acts evidence. Argument. Motion is currently denied but court open to revisiting if appropriate. Motion for admissability of relevent evidence: 1 - granted. 2 - granted. 3 - granted. 4 - granted for pawning. Not granted for not-pawning.  5 - denied except for 4/15/15 and 4/16/15. 5b - granted. 6 - granted. 7 - granted. 8 - granted. Motion for admissability of victim's pre-death non-testimonial statements. April 8, 2015 victim's statement still at issue. Argument. Denied. State's MIL: objections to 8 and 9. 8 - moot as does not apply for any witness in the case. 9 - already dealt with in evidentiary motions. DE MIL: All granted but 9. 9 is denied.
